text: Keiko Tanaka-Ikeda (田中-池田 敬子, born Keiko Tanaka; November 11, 1933 – May 13, 2023), is a Japanese amateur athlete, coach, university professor and sports administrator. She is best known as a gymnast who competed in the 1956 Summer Olympics, in the 1960 Summer Olympics, and in the 1964 Summer Olympics.Sports Reference.com (SR/Olympics), "Keiko Tanaka-Ikeda" ; retrieved 2012-7-19. She won a gold medal on the balance beam at the 1954 World Gymnastics Championships. She is the only Japanese woman to win a gold medal in this international competition.International Gymnastics Hall of Fame, Keiko Ikeda; retrieved 2012-7-19. Tanaka-Ikeda died from brain cancer at a nursing home in Kawasaki, Kanagawa, on May 13, 2023, at the age of 89. ==History== ===Timeline=== * 1954: World Championships Gold Medal, balance beam * 1958: World Championships Bronze Medal, balance beam and floor exercise * 1962: World Championships Bronze Medal, balance Beam and team * 1964: Olympic Games Bronze Medal, team * 1966: World Championships Silver Medal, uneven bars; and Bronze Medal, all-around and team ==Honors== * International Gymnastics Hall of Fame, 2002 ==Related pages== * Sports in Japan * Japan at the Olympics ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2023 deaths Category:1956 Summer Olympics Category:Competitors at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Japanese gymnasts Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Hiroshima Prefecture Category:Sports executives and administrators
title: Keiko Ikeda
